snippet: A Republican report concluded that the administration continued funding for a program central to the health insurance law without congressional approval....
abstract: Report from two House committees finds Obama administration spent $7 billion on consumer cost-reduction program, central aspect of Affordable Care Act, without Congressional authority; investigation finds administration went to 'great lengths' to hinder scrutiny of money.
lead_paragraph: A Republican report concluded that the administration continued funding for a program central to the health insurance law without congressional approval.

headline.main: House G.O.P. Returns Focus to Obamacare’s Spending Authority
headline.print_headline: Report by House G.O.P. Returns Focus to Health Care Law’s Spending Authority

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
